verses.roman:
dehy āvayoḥ samucitāny
aṅga vāsāṁsi cārhatoḥ
bhaviṣyati paraṁ śreyo
dātus te nātra saṁśayaḥ

synonyms: dehi—please give; āvayoḥ—to Us two; samucitāni—suitable; aṅga—My dear; vāsāṁsi—clothes; ca—and; arhatoḥ—to the two who are deserving; bhaviṣyati—there will be; param—supreme; śreyaḥ—benefit; dātuḥ—for the giver; te—you; na—there is not; atra—in this matter; saṁśayaḥ—doubt.
translation: [Lord Kṛṣṇa said:] Please give suitable garments to the two of Us, who certainly deserve them. If you grant this charity, you will undoubtedly receive the greatest benefit.
